PressureRecord.summary: NOTE Experimental The PressureRecord interface is part of the Compute Pressure API and describes the pressure trend of a source at a specific moment of transition.

PressureRecordSource.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only source property is a string indicating the origin source from which the record is coming.
PressureRecordSource.value: A string indicating the origin source from which the record is coming. The current version of the Compute Pressure API specification supports two main source types:Use the static hint to see which source types are supported by your browser. Note that availability can also vary by your operating system and your hardware. Call and check for a NotSupportedError to see if pressure observation is possible.

PressureRecordTime.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only time property returns the {{domxref("DOMHighResTimeStamp","timestamp", "", "no-code")}} recorded for a . It corresponds to the time the data was obtained from the system relative to the time origin of the global object in which the generated the notification.
PressureRecordTime.value: A representing the timestamp when the was created.

PressureRecordState.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only state property is a string indicating the pressure state recorded.
PressureRecordState.value: A string indicating the pressure state recorded. The Compute Pressure API uses human-readable pressure states with the following semantics (see also the specification):

PressureRecordToJSON.summary: NOTE Experimental The toJSON() method is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
PressureRecordToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
